comment: Teach yourself if he is your last option. He's very fast paced. The test are ridiculous, open ended. Attend class because you don't know when he's giving a quiz. You have to purchase My Math Lab for homework(online textbook) which isn't bad because you get unlimited chances to make a 100%
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Ive always gotten As in math, but not in prof Adler's class. He gives no review or study guide, and the tests are atleast 8 pages of open ended questions. I wouldn't recommend this class if you even slightly struggle in math. If you do take it,  prepare for surprise quizzes, lots of homework, and lengthy lectures. I Personally do no recommend him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Don't take Professor Adler. I've always been really good at math, but Professor Adler made me feel stupid. His explanations were "This equals this just because". He's a very nice and smart guy, but he doesn't know how to teach the material.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Do. Not. Take. Him. This was by far the hardest class I've ever taken. He solves problems the longest way possible and if you solve it another way he won't give you full credit. Super tough grader and has no leeway on helping you out. He also gets distracted very easily and won't talk about the material.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: If you are not strong in math and need extra time and explanation to understand do not take Dr Adler. He is an extremely tough grader. Beware of pop quizzes !!!!  He knows what he is doing, he just doesn't know how to explain it properly and goes through his notes extremely fast. Expects you to memorize every single formula for final.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: I have always gotten A's in math but this course was different. He is a very hard teacher with long lectures. Had to put in a lot of time to just get a C in the class. Gives a ton of homework online. He tells the class the amount of people whom make A's,B's,C's and below on the test. 75% of the people on test make D's and below.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: He knows his math. I will give him that, but if you don't have any experience with precalculus, do not take him. He goes through problems quickly, however he is willing to help if you don't understand. It is very difficult to receive an A, but a B is possible. He does pop quizzes every other week.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is a great teacher who knows his math.  Goes slowly and gives many examples before moving on to make sure everyone understands.  Take good notes and do your homework, and this class should be a breeze.  Also, gives extra credit based on how much effort and hard work you do.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's a good teacher, you just really need to pay attention in class and go to every class because he does give quizzes out almost every class, at least at the beginning. Homework is a must and you really need to apply yourself in his class because he really makes you work for it
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I would not recommend to anyone. I am a strong engineering major and even then his class is difficult. Lectures are extremely tough to pay attention to. Makes math not enjoyable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Do not take unless you are very strong in math... you have to attend every class because he gives pop quizzes randomly every week... his lectures are terrible and fast paced Assumes you already know everything.... he grades very hard and even claims he throws in tricks in his test questions to fool students. NO study guide for tests!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Fairly hard tests, but overall a good teacher. He's always willing to help explain a problem, but the lectures are boring and hard to stay in tune.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I don't recommend taking him for anyone who is not strong and self taught in math. He assumes you know the material already due to precalc being a high school course so he doesn't teach material, just reviews it. Pop quizzes once a week at the last 15 minutes of class, lots of homework, really tough on test grading.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I have always been a good student and made good grades until this year with Adler.. Extremely smart person but not an excellent conveyor of information during class. HW is difficult and takes forever. During class, I was often lost. He will try to help you out. Wastes classtime with stories and is very dismissive to students. Nice enough person.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Good at explaining but very long-winded. Quizzes were totally random, 1 or 2 problems, and often at the end of class. Tests were similar to HW but not identical; understanding of concepts was necessary. He's willing to answer your questions and mold the class to fit the level of students.  Overall a good teacher as long as you put in the work.

No doubt he is very smart, but not everyone else is the same. He assumes we all know the material. I basically taught myself with MyMathLab. Tests are not similar to the homework. The hw takes forever. I don't think I'll take him again, bad first experience.

NO doubt he is very smart, but not everyone else is the same. He assumes we all know the material. I basically taught myself with MyMathLab. Tests are not similar to the homework, which take forever. I don't think I'll take him again, bad first experience.

His lectures are terrible for anyone not inclined towards math. He is also insulting, constantly saying, "You should know this already." So, if you ask a question or get a question wrong out loud in class, he treats you like you're stupid. You HAVE to do the homework and study it like crazy. That's the only way I understand and get A's.

I got all the help I could get from outside resources and still made a C. Adler doesn't give curves or extra credit. Sometimes goes off topic during the lecture. He uses Hawkes, so the homework can take a LONG time to finish. Gives pop quizzes, and tests dont always relate to homework or lectures.

He rarely talks about the actual subject as assumes that the whole class already understands the material. He does not under any conditions give a curve even if the class average is well below failing. He is probably one of the worst teachers I had ever had.

I took Adler for Calc I. Some people might say he gives a lot of homework but I think I learned a lot from the homework. He is very considerate and helpful to those who want to learn. The tests were relatively easy, the hardest part was the pop quizzes. I would take a class from him again if I could.

Took for pre cal. Terrible experience! Adler is very confusing, and assumes that every student is a "math genius" and has 3 hours every night to devote to homework. Tells you he will help you and then if you go see him does not help at all. If you struggle with advanced math stay FAR AWAY! I will never take him again.

I have Adler now for Algebra, and I have mixed emotions. He really doesn't use the book all that often except to get examples for the notes. The software you have to get is a bit expensive, but you do the homework he assigns from the software and he generates his tests from it. He is more than willing to help during office office. It's not too hard
Wouldn't be my top choice professor for any course. Very knowledgeable man, but he isn't the best teacher when it comes to explaining concepts.
Test are super hard and he thinks you already know the material
Tests are very tough

Test are not hard and he  grades fairly easy, always wants you to show the work and include the steps though. He will give you partial points so long as you attempt the problems on test, so never leave a problem blank. The lectures were pretty clear but dull. Homework is done online and can be quite tedious.
goes through material fast and assumes students know all the material already. wouldn't recommend taking his class
not help full at all when it comes to actuall work. he only teaches from notes that are really ineffective at all and can be really difficult to cope with
One of the first professors I took after transfering to So Po. Ended up taking Alfred for precalc calc and then calc dos. An overall great teacher. Clear lecturer, intuitive tests, and helpful.

Tries to be fair with grading, which is very helpful as Calc 2 is by no means an easy subject. Gives a decent amount of HW that is turned in with the tests, but don't worry - he just checks for completion, doesn't nitpick through it and mark you off.

Monotonically constant.. He does not waste a second of class time. If there are 2 minutes left of class, he will start a whole new section. He has a lot of shortcuts for the problems but they end up confusing the majority of the class. Lots of problems for HW.

He is a physic's major. A lot of his work shows, he skips too many steps, and takes too many short cuts that only makes sense to him. He gives two big midterm tests and a final. No room for mistakes so be aware when you take this guy.

Really great professor. Mandatory is required everyday that it is stated and homework was due everyday before class. He does like to tell stories, but those are his tangent conversations that originate from a problem he's talking about. I only made a C because I missed one test (which was recorded as a 0) and I didn't do well on the final.
He's very helpful and willing to help, but hard to understand in class.

Gives anywhere from 30 to 60 hw problems. He talks alot in class about things that have nothing to do with math. Gets behing in his schedule alot and therefore gives double assignments at night. If you go to him for help, he will tell you to go talk to the ATTIC. His teachers assistant explains the material better than he does.

Gives anywhere from 30 to 60 hw problems. He talks alot in class about things that have nothing to do with math. Gets behing in his schedule alot and therefore gives double assignments at night. If you go to him for help, he will tell you to go talk to the ATTIC. His teachers assistant explains the material better than he does.
He gives lots of hw, you study then you get his tests and none of what you studied is on it.

One of the best college professors I've had.  He breaks up every lesson, and will work with you if you don't understand something.  He does assign a lot of homework, but it's all very helpful for his exams.
He is too smart for himself. His notes are not very clear and sporadic all over the board. A lot of homework. He is however willing to help.

Adler is very good at his job, I had him for pre-calc and took him for Calc I. He does indeed give lots of hw, but guess what, it's college. :) I love learning from him, take him if you want to learn and get a good-grade while you're doing it~
Although he is a good teacher he gives like 40 problems a night compared to others who give like 10 problems or even none sometimes

He was a great teacher, sadly I only had classes with him for one week, but I coud understand everything he tought. He tries to help everyone understand and he teaches slowly but throughout :) I loved the class A+++
He make possible to understand the subject. Most importantly his exam question will come from h.w. problem. But he also collects all h.w. I highly recommended his for Physics.

Entertaining, and excellent teacher. Fair with grading, test questions moderate. He enjoys teaching and wants you to learn and is there for you after class if you need help. He does expect you to complete your homework ontime. Want to enjoy learning, then take Dr. Adler's class.

Great professor for Physics 1.  He made the class interesting and added some history of the information that we were learning that made it interesting.  He posts his notes on his web page for students to reference which helped out nicely.  I would take another course from him.
Very intelligent professor that is willing to help students.  Extremely fair with grading and willing to give points back on test if deserved.

This has by far been the toughest course I've ever taken. I didn't find his teaching methods efficient or useful. Homework must always be turned in, and while attendance isn't mandantory, it is hard to catch up after missing just one class. He skims over the material very quickly. He's a very nice man but not a very helpful professor.

He's a nice guy.  Not necessarily easy, but he goes the extra length to be fair while still making sure you comprehend the material.  The only downside is that HE COLLECTS HOMEWORK!  --I haven't had a teacher collect homework in ages; it nearly brought my A down to a B, but he was kind enough to push me up, I guess...
